Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 02 Jan 2019Personally, I dont think you should 'learn' investing/trading by copying others (futhermore with no guaranteed returns). Follow a rule: If you dont understand, dont follow.There are many useful and free resources online (books, blogs, articles and the myriad) you can refer to to pick up investing. Alternatively, you can opt for ETFs which requires monthly investment of at least $100. Keep in mind to do your own research first before starting.As for eToro, it is safe. eToro deals mainly with CFD (a derivative product which relies heavily on leveraging, meaning losses can be massive). Again, if you don't understand the product, don't go there. Start of with conventional equities. When you're familiar with the system, then you can start exploring futures and derivatives.0 comments0
